skill.name: linear-projects-write
skill.description: Create and update Linear projects via CLI (write operations)
skill.summary: Create and update Linear projects via CLI (write operations)
skill.author: Bind

security_audit.summary: This is a metadata-only skill definition containing only configuration and documentation files. No executable source code is present in the directory. The skill provides CLI interfaces for Linear project management but lacks implementation files referenced in skill.json.

content.value_statement: Managing Linear projects manually takes time and can lead to inconsistent project setups. This skill provides simple CLI commands to create and update Linear projects directly from your terminal with standardized options for teams, leads, dates, and priorities.
actual_capabilities: Create new Linear projects with name, teams, and description
Update existing projects with new name, description, lead, or status
Set project dates including start date and target date
Configure project priority levels from urgent to low
Support partial name matching for project identification
Output results in JSON format for automation
limitations: Requires LINEAR_API_KEY environment variable to be set
Source files not included in this registry definition
User names must exist in Linear to resolve project leads
Bun runtime must be installed to execute commands

use_cases.title: Quick project setup
use_cases.description: Create new feature branches and projects in Linear with one command

use_cases.title: Standardize project workflows
use_cases.description: Ensure all new projects follow consistent naming and priority conventions

use_cases.title: Automate project creation
use_cases.description: Integrate project creation into CI/CD pipelines for automated sprint setup

prompt_templates.title: Create simple project
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Linear project called [Project Name] for the [Team Name] team

prompt_templates.title: Create project with details
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new project with name [Name], teams [Team1,Team2], description [Description], lead [Lead Name], start date [YYYY-MM-DD], target date [YYYY-MM-DD], and priority [Priority Level]

prompt_templates.title: Update project status
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the [Project Name] project to show status [New Status] and target date [YYYY-MM-DD]

prompt_templates.title: Full project update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update project [Project Identifier] with new name [Name], description [Description], lead [Lead Name or none], status [Status], start date [YYYY-MM-DD], target date [YYYY-MM-DD], and priority [0-4]

output_examples.input: Create a Linear project called Q2 Feature for the Engineering team with high priority

best_practices: Store LINEAR_API_KEY securely in environment variables or .env files
Use consistent naming conventions across all projects for easier searching
Set target dates during project creation to track delivery timelines
Add clear descriptions to help team members understand project scope
anti_patterns: Creating projects without descriptions makes tracking purpose difficult
Skipping team assignment limits visibility and access control
Using inconsistent naming conventions breaks partial name matching
Ignoring priority settings leads to unclear work prioritization

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Install the skill and use Linear commands in your natural language prompts.

faq.question: How many projects can I create or update?
faq.answer: The skill uses Linear API rate limits. For bulk operations, implement delays between requests to avoid hitting limits.

faq.question: Does this integrate with existing Linear workspaces?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill connects to any Linear workspace where your API key has access. Team and user permissions apply.

faq.question: Is my Linear data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill only accesses Linear through authenticated API calls. Your API key is never stored or transmitted beyond Linear API endpoints.

faq.question: Why is my project not found during updates?
faq.answer: Verify the project name or ID is correct. The skill supports partial name matching but case sensitivity applies. Check that you have access to the project.

faq.question: How does this compare to Linear web interface?
faq.answer: This skill enables faster project creation through automation and templates. The web interface offers more configuration options and visual project boards.
